name: Qawasqar

rows: Bo, Sk record tasel for Central QWS.
Also takʰay-tkal; kyot-kʰar, cf. 'behind' 12.011.Bo records kyotkʰar for Central QWS. Hy records tokʰol; Fi records tokʰal-kte for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Fe record c̷eɬaper for Central QWS.
From Ag. Also means 'womb' 04.470. Ag records kʰac̷en (also 'womb'); ows-kstay. Sk, Bo, Be, Co record kʰac̷el; Gui records kapatye, for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kopote for South QWS.
Also Ag, Em record arakstawar. Bo records akwel for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record okwel for South QWS.
Also akyawe, which also means 'night' and 'dark'. Bo, SpC record terekal; Gus, Sk record [pˀal], from Selknam 'pˀàr'. Fi records fkal; SpS records akyewokar for South QWS.
ClC, Sk, Bo, Be record kyeplayek for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record [sopa], from Yagan 'sapa'.
Sk, Bo record the same for Central QWS. Hy records the same for South QWS; Fi, Hy record oskya for South QWS.
Also kaweskʰar-yeke, lit. 'person-?-small' (02.100 and 12.560). Bo, Fe record ayol for Central QWS. SpS records ayol for South QWS. Fi records kose 'baby' for South QWS.
Cf. 'up' 12.080 and 'weave' 06.330. Bo, Li record the same for Central QWS. Gui records ayel, (cf. 'fog' 01.740). Hy records yel for South QWS.
Also kyepc̷es, which also means 'freeze'. Sk, Bo, Be, Gui record kyesas for Central QWS. Fi, SpS record kesas for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Be, Gui record kala for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record anokwal for South QWS.
Also c̷elas-na; both forms also mean 'to dry'. Ag records anktsok.
sin filo, mocho, desafilado, embotado, romo

Bo, Be, Co record the same for Central QWS. AgC, Sk, Bo, Lu, Gui record kwerkyal; Sk, Bo, Fe record tel-kyol, which also means 'hear, listen', for Central QWS. Hy records tel; Fi records tel-tel for South QWS. Cf. 'hear' 15.410.
Bo, SpC, Gui record leɬe; Sk, Bo, Fe record yoreɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record leɬe for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Co, Be, Li, Lu, Fe, Gui record teɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record teɬ for South QWS.
Also kyewyof. Bo records akate, cf. 'north' 12.470; Bo, Gui record xawel for Central QWS.
Also c̷ec̷ar. Sk, Bo record c̷ec̷ar; AgC, Bo record terweya for Central QWS. Fi records c̷awol; SpS records tarwaya for South QWS.
'Plumage' is takyes. Various types of feathers are: Em, terk-terk; atke; ayoyewara; away. Bo, Sk, c̷apaɬ; Cy, terkar, for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, ayes, for South QWS.
Also means 'firewood'. Bo, Fe, SpC, Li record c̷ˀarkwes; Sk records statal for Central QWS, (cf. 'embers' 01.841). Fi, Hy, SpS record tetel for South QWS.
Sk, Bo record yekstaɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record yekstaɬ for South QWS.
Also kyeplas; alaxar. Sk records c̷etas for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo, Fe, Cy record the same for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record the same for South QWS.
Bo records the same for Central QWS.
Sk, Spc, Co, Li, Fe, Lu record the same for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record yekapar for South QWS, which also means 'forearm'.
Lit. 'eye-instrumental' 04.210. Also kaftal-kʰar. Bo, Cy, Li record orkwar for Central QWS. Fi records oftsoka for South QWS.
Fi, Hy record pakel for South QWS.
Also means 'we' 02.940. Sk, Bo record c̷eɬ for Central QWS. SpS records c̷o for South QWS.
Sk, Bo record kyoc̷-ktel for Central QWS.
Also means 'branch' 08.550; and 'fishscale' 03.653. Sk records kɬe for Central QWS. SpS records kenar.
Sk, Bo. Be, Fe, Lu, Gui record the same for Central QWS. North and Central form also means 'foot'. Fi, Hy record kʰot for South QWS.
Bo records atʰaken for Central QWS.
Also Ag records tawanap; kamalay. Bo records teseper for Central QWS.
Gus, Sk record akses for Central QWS. Fi records akyenes for South QWS.
ClC, AgC, Sk, Bo, Ca, Se, Si, Fe record [yeper], from Selknam 'yèpr', for Central QWS. SpS records alkaɬ for South QWS.

seles means 'female'. Cf. yekap-c̷ewe, 'toward evening'. Also arka-k-seles (cf. 'up' 12.080). Ag, Em record akyewe-k-seles (cf. 'dark' 15.630). Bo, Sk, Be, Gui record yekaps-alok for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record [konako], from Yagan, for South QWS. In
Sk, Bo, SpC record the same for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record the same for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Be, Li, Cv, Lu record af-kɬtay for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record of-yare for South QWS. Cf. 'lip' 04.250; 'chin' 04.209.
Also Ag records kelaf-estal; and yer-kʰar, which also means 'Adam's apple'. Sk, Be record kyoɬer-kʰar; Bo records c̷aɬertar for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record c̷aɬe-kʰar for South QWS.
Also means 'good, pretty'. Also c̷ˀepac̷ewel, which also means 'clean'.

Also means 'darkness' 01.620. Also yakapc̷ewe, which also means 'get dark'. Bo, Be, SpC record akyowe; Sk records kɬepe, which also means 'dark', for Central QWS. Hy records ako; Fi, Hy record yolape for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Co, Gui record lowɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record nowɬ for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Fe record tako-tako for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record takwayto for South QWS.
Gui records the same for Central QWS. Bo records xalel for Central QWS. SpS records af for South QWS.
Neutral morpheme; no verb-noun differentiation. Also kapkas. Sk, Ir record apers; Bo, SpC record kapkas for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kapkas for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, SpC record kyero for Central QWS. SpS records tˀel for South QWS. Cf. 'yellow' 15.690.
wes is 'earth'. Also Ag records kskareks; alo. Bo records wes-epel for Central QWS.
From Ag. Cf. 'stinking' 15.260. Ag. records fkanoks-na; Gui records paskes.
Bo records kyapc̷akɬ for Central QWS. Hy records [pawntel] for South QWS, from Yagan 'pantel'.
Bo records takʰol-kʰar for Central QWS.
Bo, Sk record kos; Bo records yelo for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kokolayek for South QWS.
arka means 'up' 12.080. Also astes-c̷ewe. Bo, Sk record arka for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record akowa for South QWS.
Also means 'few'. Sk, Bo, Gui record yekyot for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record yekwat for South QWS.
Bo, SpC, Gui record tˀelks for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record tˀelks for South QWS. Cf. 'tobacco' 08.680.
Also yekapc̷ewe-k-seles, which also means 'moon'. Bo, Sk, SpC, Ca, Gui record kolas for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, Sps record konas for South QWS.
Also Em records alkareske. Bo, Sk, Co, Ca record kyeɬaw; AgC records kalkayeske for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record keɬaw for South QWS.
Also meltel, 'fish tail'. Ag, Em record kyoc̷ok, 'bird tail'.
Bo records c̷awɬ-kyekal for Central QWS.
Also Ag, Em record keya. Sk, Bo record afke; Bo records kstas, cf. 'long' 12.570, for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record ofke for South QWS.
Also Ag, Em record kolet. Sk, Bo record ayep for Central QWS.
Bo, Sk, Gui record c̷awɬ for Central QWS.
Also kyelef-atel, cf. 'neck' 04.280. Em records arkstay. Sk, Bo, Gui record yel-kʰar; Sk records kyelef for Central QWS. Cf. 'neck' 04.280.
From Ag. Sk, Bo record wokɬ-tow for Central QWS. Cf. 'two' 13.020 and 'other' tow. Fi, Hy record kopep for South QWS.
Also Ag records keyero, which means 'red' 15.660. Bo, SpC, Gui record takal for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kayero for South QWS.
Also kc̷erafna, which also means 'sting'. Gus records yetas, cf. North yetaxaf, 'to eat well'. Fi, Hy records ekanes for South QWS.
Also sekwayeks. Gui records sekwas; Bo records sekolayek for Central QWS.
Also c̷eke-xak. Bo, Sk, Gui record lec̷al for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record yamaskona for South QWS.
Also peykyo, which also means 'to boil'.
Sk, Bo, SpC, Li record at-ksta for Central QWS. Fi, SpS record yel-ksta for South QWS.
Also Em records kenc̷as; oftak. Bo records c̷ereseso for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kopa for South QWS.
Also kʰanana 'dead one'. Gus, Sk, Bo, Cy record tˀef; Fe records alkelera for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record welarkarwona for south QWS.
Also aktsa-wes; aktso-lay. Bo records aktso-lay; aktso-kwar for Central QWS. The North and Central forms also mean 'water' 01.310. Fi, Hy record afkela; Hy records c̷akol for South QWS.
Also asake. Sk, Bo, Gui, Li record lefes; Bo, Be, SpC record tool for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record lofes for South QWS.
Also karksayeks. Both forms mean 'slip and fall'. Sk, SpC record korkal for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record alas for South QWS. Cf. 'fly' 10.370.
Also means 'to be afraid'. Sk records kyelo for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record otɬe for South QWS.
Also alayek. Sk records apas for Central QWS, cf. 'swift' 14.210. Fi, Hy record alas for South QWS.
From Ag, Em, also means 'listen'. Sk records tel-kyol for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record teles for South QWS.
Also c̷elayker; c̷eyekar; c̷enak; c̷ektsaar; yerkʰo-lay.
Also eykwaker, which also means 'hit'. Em records yerakyar, 'kill with a stick'. Bo records kar for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record oftokola for South QWS.
Sk records koy for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo record aleksta for Central QWS. Fi records feayel for South QWS.
Sk, Bo record pap for Central QWS. Cf. 'sit' 12.140.
Sk, Bo record le-ksor for Central QWS.
Cf. 'throw a stick, hunt' yefto-lay; 'throw rocks' xowtas; 'to spear' akyar; kerkstes. Bo, Gui record kaynel; Bo records akyar for Central QWS. SpS records yeftela for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, SpC record sakar for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record sokar for South QWS.
Also Ag, Em, Ha record kwonak; kawokyar. Bo, Sk, Be record c̷erksta for Central QWS, cf. 'snore' 04.612. Fi, Hy record kekyol for South QWS.
Fi, Hy record oks for South QWS. Cf. 'fragrant' 15.250 and 'stinking' 15.260.
Also yerksa. Bo records flokyar for Central QWS.
Means 'get up/rise'. 'Standing' is arkaw, cf. 'up' 12.080. Bo, Gui record arkaw for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record arko for South QWS.
Also means 'thief'. Bo, Gui record akwas for Central QWS.
Also Ag records c̷afakso. Bo records c̷afala for Central QWS. Cf. 'drink' 05.130.
Sk records elpay for Central QWS. Fi, Hy records lempay for South QWS.
Also Ag records tkal. ClC records kapelas for Central QWS.
Also ksapatal; yestal; and as, which also means 'go'. Bo records as for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record as for South QWS.
Also Ag records antˀeleke. Bo records kartola for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo, Be, Co, Fe, Se, Lu record lekel for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record loken for South QWS.
Sk, Bo, Be, Co, Fe, Se, Lu record the same for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo record wokɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record telkwaw for South QWS.

Also akc̷awes; akc̷o-lay. Bo records akc̷o-lay for Central QWS. AgC, Gus, Sk, Bo, Be, SpC, Cy record akc̷o-kwar for Central QWS. All these forms also mean 'drink'. Fi, Hy, SpS record c̷awas for South QWS.
Also c̷ams, which also means 'sea'. Sk records stolaka for Central QWS. Cf. 'drop' 10.160.
Also kwa, which also means 'how?'. Bo records akwaɬ for Central QWS.
SpC records ekefkar; Sk, Bo, SpC record yekapeskar for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record akefkar for South QWS.
Bo records peɬe for Central QWS. SpS records paɬeɬ for South QWS.
Sk, Bo record kyawya for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record walok for South QWS, cf. 'female' 02.240.
Bo, Sk record akatel for Central QWS. Fi, HY record orkwas for South QWS.
From Em. Bo records tarwa for Central QWS. North and Central forms also mean 'hand' 04.330.
SpC, Gui record eɬatap; AgC, Sk, Bo record serks for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record eɬarapes for South QWS.
Bo records the same for Central QWS.
Bo records kwoy-kyekal for Central QWS. SpS records okakɬ for South QWS.
Also means 'leg' 04.350. Bo, Co record the same for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kʰot-lekolkol for South QWS.
From Ag, cf. 'calf of leg' 04.352. Fi, Hy record akolapa for South QWS, which also means 'wrist' 04.321.
Sk, Bo record akot for Central QWS.
Lit. 'tree-skin' 04.120. Gui records kowas; Bo records taras for Central QWS, cf. 'paper' 18.560. SpS records penar for South QWS.
Cf. ksteyes 'scrape, scratch'. Sk records yekɬ for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record eskol for South QWS.
Sk, Bo record c̷elak for Central QWS. SpS records c̷ena- for South QWS.

Lit. 'day-(suffix)-female' 14.410 + 02.240. Also arka-k-seles, which also means 'moon'. Also ac̷e-ksta; ac̷ˀayes, which both mean 'hot'. Bo, Sk, Be, SpC, Gui record arx-alok for Central QWS. South QWS is [lom], from Yagan 'lam'.
Bo and Gui record the same for Central QWS. Cf. 'sky' 01.510; 'up' 12.080. Also wes-kʰar; cf. 'earth' 01.210.
Sk, Bo also record arkʰar for Central QWS. North and Central forms also mean 'blue'.
Also aw-af-na, which also means 'burn'. Sk, Bo, Gui record apʰel for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record ketkayk for South QWS.
From Ag. Bo records arc̷oyeskes for Central QWS.
Bo, Cy record the same for Central QWS. SpS records the same for South QWS.
mitu, montete (Peru), paujil/panjuil (Peru), paujil de Salvin (Peru for Mitu salvini)
Northern Amazonia (N of Solimões), not in northern Colombia; Dark-winged trumpeter is found south of Solimões
Different types have different localized ranges
Also Ag records takwatro. Bo records xolaps cor Central QWS. Fi, Hy record telkewol for South QWS.
loro real, loro (Sp. form is a loan from Carib)
Co records parpa for Central QWS. SpS records palpa for South QWS.
Bo records yakaraɬap for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record akoreka for South QWS.

AgC, Bo, Sk record the same for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record the same for South QWS. Refers to 'pato quetro'. Of the many names for 'duck', this term is the only one occurring in all three dialect areas.
ClC, AgC, Gus, Sk, Bo, SpC, Co, Fe Li, Gui record salkʰe for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record selokʰe for south QWS.
sachaperro, Perro de Monte, Zorro Vinagre, Guanfando; Zorro Ojizarco, Zorro Negro, Perro de Orejas Corta
oso hormiguero; tapia pelejo or pelejo chico for Cyclopes didactylus
Myrmecophaga tridactyla (giant anteater); Cyclopes didactylus (silky anteater)
armadillo, carachupa (Peru), yangunturi (Peru for Giant armadillo)
family Dasypodidae; e.g. Priodontes maximus (Giant armadillo), Dasypus novemcinctus, Dasypus kappleri
Melanosuchus niger, Caiman schlerops; Paleosuchus sp.
Port term reportedly borrowed from Tupi
Sk, Bo, Fe, Li record yawc̷el for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record [apompen], from Yagan 'apom', for South QWS.
maparate (used in Peru for some types of catfish, including Auchenipterus sp.), cunchi (used in Peru for some types of catfish), bagre (catfish)
iguana' is reportedly from Arawak iwana
boa; mantona (red-tailed boa); boa de altura
Yellow-footed: Geochelone denticulata; Red-footed: Geochelone carbonaria
Downstream of major rapids and waterfalls
Bo records saktar for Central QWS. SpS records saktal for South QWS.
prioritize generic term that includes any edible species
Mature forests of Rio Negro and Upper Amazon
may be confused in some entries with O. bataua
moriche (Col, Ven), aguaje (Col, Peru), achual, miriti
Brazil, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, French Guiana, Guyana, Peru, Venezuela; in and near swamps
pui, irapay, hoja de irapay, caraná
Mauritiella armata OR Lepidocaryum tenue (irapay), Mauritius carana
Mauritia carana is limited principally to the Rio Negro and Upper Orinoco regions; dry catinga forests
chontaduro (Col, Ecuador); pipire (Col); pijuayo (Peru), pijiguao (Ven); tembe (Bol)
ungurahui (Peru), palma de seje, milpesos, patabá
mostly north of Equator; common in Amazonia
may be confused with O. bacaba - compare entries
secondary scrub vegetation. lower alt. of eastern Andes
Gossypium (barbadense: long fibers; hirsutum: short fibers)
plant; some sources may confound with kapok Ceiba pentandra (esp. if a single gloss for 'cotton' is given')
ceiba, huimba, lupuna (Peru for Ceiba sp.)
northern South America and central America; common in disturbed areas
Capsicum sp., principally chinensis and frutescens
maní (may be loan from Taino Arawak), cacahuete
caña flecha, caña brava, caña isana
banano, banana, cambur, bellaco, variedad de plátano
From Span. 'poroto'. Also Em records aleyakstoska; c̷atalakska.
From Ag, Em. Also means 'pasture' ksakawes. Bo record tsapɬ; Bo, Sk, Gui record sakalef for Central QWS. Hy records sakalef; Fi records ketare; Fi, Hy record kal for South QWS.
Also means 'cigarette'. Cf. 'smoke' 01.830', footnote. Bo records tˀelks for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo record the same for Central QWS. North and Central forms also mean 'stick' and 'bone'. Fi, Hy record yaroka; Fi, Hy record kafsa for South QWS.
secondary scrub vegetation and indigenous gardens
Secondary scrub vegetation and indigenous gardens. North and South America (Brazil, Peru, Bolivia, Suriname, Colombia)
secondary scrub vegetation and indigenous gardens
tortuga caspi, pretina (Peru for tree and tumpline); carahuasca (Peru)
Duguetia sp. OR Fusaea longifolia OR Guatteria chrysopetala
castanha do para (B. excelsa); castanha de cutia (C. edulis)
Bertholletia excelsa [cf. Couepia edulis 'castanha do cutia']

1) Couepia: restricted area within Brazil, Rio Purus basin and middle Solimões.  2) Bertholletia: elev: consistently about 200m; mature forests. Widely distributed from Peru, E. Colombia, Brazil to Nicaragua.
anarcado, castaña de cajú, nuez de la India, marañon, cajú, merey (Venezuela)
secondary scrub vegetation and indigenous gardens
tree; most sources will not distinguish between occidentale and other varieties
jagua, majagua - Colombia, caruto, xagua - Venezuela, bigrande - Bolivia, huito, yaguayagua - Peru, ygualti - Nicaragua, maluco - Mexico
native to NW Amazonia, found primarily in Vaupes and Caqueta regions
other species of Pouteria exist and have much-used edible fruit; these can be subsituted where relevant
uva de monte, uvilla (Peru), puruma, caime, caimarona (and variants; Col.)
grows wild in Western Amazon basin; cultivated in Colombia since pre-Colombian times
a tree; not a true grape

not generally cultivated in western (subAndean) Amazon. Arroyo-Kalin (2010) argues for a correlation with distribution of dark earths, mostly formed after 1AD, and the modeled-incised pottery tradition.

Provides more starch and is more pest-resistant than the sweet variety, but requires much processing. Arroyo-Kalin (2010) proposes that bitter type was developed from sweet through post-ceremic agricultural intensification (motivated by high starch yield
Primary staple in western/subAndean Amazonia, less important elsewhere
No processing required, but lower starch yield and pest resistance than bitter variety

calabazo, calabaza; auyama (Dominican Republic and Venezuela), ayote (parts of Central America), zapallo (parts of South America), tutumo/totumo/totuma (Cresc tree), huingo (Peru for Crescentia cujete), tapara
Crescentia cujete (round variety - tree); (Cucurbita) Lagenaria siceraria (bottle variety - vine)
secondary forests and secondary srcrub  vegetation
semi-domesticated, native to Amazonian basin, esp. NW
bullet ant, lesser giant hunter ant
conga, hormiga yanabe (Colombia), isula (Peru), Hormiga Veinticuatro
Colombia: zampopo, hormiga arriera; Venezuela: bachaco; Peru: curuhuinse
Apis mellifera; Tetragonisca angustula; Trigona amazonensis
lampírido, luciérnaga (Peru), añañahui (Peru), cocuyo   (attributed Taino origin)
Also yewelpaks. Bo records yarklatopa for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kyekyewol; Hy records pekyol for south QWS.
Also kerpowak. Bo records torkreyol for Central QWS. All mean a worm (in general).
Fi records tomatola for South QWS. Cf. 'mosquito' 03.832.
From Ag. Also means 'fly' 03.830. Bo records keyaltak for Central QWS.
Also c̷akʰe; yamakʰas. Ag, Em record takwak. All forms refer to sea snails.
Also c̷ekyenaxar. Gui records koplap for Central QWS.
Mono Lanudo Común, Choro, Churucu, mono choro (Peru), mono lanudo cafe, barrigudo de Humboldt
mono negro (Peru), Machín Negro, Maicero Cachón, mono maicero
Machín Blanco, mono blanco, Maicero Cariblanco, mono blanco (Peru)
Machin Blanco, Mono Araña de Vientre Amarillo, maquisapa (Peru), braceadora (Colombia)
Lobo Grande de Río, nutria gigante, lutria
Nutria, Lobo de Agua, lobito de rio, perro de agua (Colombia)
sajino, pecarí de collar, jabalf, Javelina, Saíno, Pecarí de Collar
Guatusa Negra, Añuje, Agutí (black-rumped), picure, jochi colorado
Guatín, Punchana, curi, picurito rabudo, picurito rabilargo
Cuniculus paca (Agouti paca is sometimes used as well although cuniculus is the correct term.)
Also Ag records wosawa. Sk, Bo, Co, Gui record atkaɬap for Central QWS.
Gui records yec̷el for Central QWS. Refers to the 'huemul'.
Also kalakso. Sk, Bo, Co, Fe, Gui record tayo; Bo, Co record c̷ˀepas for Central QWS, which also means 'rush'. Fi, Hy record kayko for South QWS.
abalorio, mostacilla, cuenta, gota, puca; necklace=collar
Sk, Bo record pap-e-tkal for Central QWS. Cf. 'lie down' 12.140.
Used to be used by Tukanoan peoples (and others?), sound carried for long distances

In RN region, there is typically one person per village (if that) who is a full-fledged 'shaman'. He is very much a specialist and has considerable power to cure, as well as power to curse. He is respected and feared. Shamans are thought to turn themselv

Refers to a lower-level healer; in RN region, most older men in a village have this capacity, and command a repertoire of healing spells. Power is primarily for good, whereas the true shaman is capable of malignant acts as well.
AgC, Sk, Bo, Ca, Ir record ac̷ec̷o for Central QWS.
Also means 'fire'. Sk, Bo, Cy, Li, Gui record kakas for Central QWS. SpS records afsar for South QWS.
malignant forest spirit, covered with long hair, feet turned backward; in Upper Rio Negro region
espíritu malo, espíritu maligno, fantasma, demonio
From Ag. Cf. 'sky' 01.510. Also Ag records yema-arkac̷ewe-c̷kes, cf. 'white man' yema. Bo records arka-kerc̷es.
carrizo, zampoñas, flautas de pan, rondadora
Also c̷eraske, cf. 'cut' 09.220. ClC, AgC, Sk, Bo, Cy record aftaske for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record aftayla for South QWS.
Also means 'coipo's tooth' (a rodent). Sk, Bo record kareske for Central QWS. SpS record karaskal.
Also [flec̷a], from Span. 'flecha'. Sk, Bo, Ir record arkyel for South QWS. Fi, Hy record anokwa for South QWS.
From Ag. Bo records kerakʰala for Central QWS. Fi, Hy record kerekʰana for South QWS.
Also means 'fish hook'. Also Ag records tafakay.
only gathered in wild throughout Amazonia?
Also asaks. Gui records kapec̷elar for Central QWS.
yurupari, jurupari (or any flutes forbidden to women)
a ritual complex in various parts of Amazonia involving sacred flutes/trumpets, forbidden to women.
fetiche, encanto, filtro de amor,  pusanga
Cf. 'bark' 08.750, footnote. Sk, Fe record taykalka for Central QWS.
From Ag. Bo records kawakwer for Central QWS. Cf. 'bury' 04.780.
Sk, Bo record tˀelks-kʰar for Central QWS.
From Tehuelche 'čekor'. Bo, SpC record the same for Central QWS.
Sk, Bo, Ca record yereto for Central QWS.
SpC records selekɬe for Central QWS. SpS records senekye for South QWS. All the forms means 'gun'. Cf. 'sling' 20.230. Bo records takal-kwa, 'cannon' for Central QWS, cf. 'thunder' 01.560, footnote.
Also Em records ktasekseya. Both forms actually mean 'cap'.
Also yerwose, which also means 'give orders'. Sk, Bo record sefteyor for Central QWS.
Bo records c̷apɬ for Central QWS. North and Central forms also mean 'sea' 01.320. SpS records akes for South QWS.
Bo, Li record lektal for Central QWS.
currently limited to certain groups (favoring h-g orientation, e.g. Nadahup) within RN region
esp. for fanning a cooking fire
Also yektel; yefto-lay, which also means 'to throw a stick'. Bo records yepˀat for Central QWS.
Interesting correlation to 'fish' in Tukanoan languages
esp. for grating manioc, but can be used for other things as well
grid of sticks for smoking meat or placing objects (shelf)
pilón, mano de mortero, mazo, moledor
prioritizes manioc beer where distinction is made
usually manioc; agriculture, but also can be made from certain wild seeds/fruits
tipiti, matafrio, sebucán, exprimador, prensa para yuca
word of Tupi origin; agriculture: specifically for squeezing poison out of manioc
hunting, currently is falling out of use in Vaupés region, associated primarily with h-g groups (but this may be recent?)
agriculture? commonly used for sifting dry manioc flour
can refer to worms; more generic
if different word from top grinding stone
use word for top grinding stone if different from bottom stone
Sk, Bo, SpC record the same for Central QWS. AgC, Bi, SpC record at-apye for Central QWS. Fi, Hy, SpS record at for South QWS.
